about_the_game:
Discover ‘Harmony’ with the China Railways HXD1, a new Chinese electric locomotive from Just Trains.

The HXD1 is a high-power electric heavy freight unit created by Siemens and the CRRC Zhuzhou Electric Locomotive company. Based on the Eurosprinter platform, this is a powerful and versatile locomotive that has played a pivotal role in China’s railway transportation system. Known for its exceptional performance and reliability it represents a new generation of electric machines designed to meet increasing demands of an expanding network. The HXD1 is often referred to as ‘Harmony’ reflecting the locomotive’s role in promoting efficiency, reduced emissions, low energy consumption, and reliable running on China’s railway system.

Built in detail for Train Simulator and ready for heavy freight running on Chinese routes the HXD1 features an authentic detailed cab with realistic controls that include in-cab displays, anti-drowsiness alarm (ADVS), automatic train protection (ATP) to monitor speed, LKJ Supervision systems to prevent wheel slip, cruise control, in-cab signalling and more.

Included with this pack are a selection of freight wagons. The C62 multi-purpose gondola, P54 freight box car, NX70A freight wagons (loaded and unloaded) and three types of G60K light oil tanker. These are used in the various scenarios included with the locomotive for the South West China High Speed and Longhai Railway: Lingbao – Mianchi routes.

Start hauling freight with this powerful China flagship locomotive, the HXD1 is now ready for service in Train Simulator.

Included Scenarios


The China Railways HXD1 Loco Add-On includes 5 Scenarios for Longhai Railway and 3 Scenarios for South West China High Speed.

  • Standard - Guang'an South to Hechuan (South West China High Speed)
  • Standard - Nanchong to Suining (South West China High Speed)
  • Standard - Direct to Suining (South West China High Speed)
  • Standard - Rescue train to Sanmenxiaxi (Longhai Railway)
  • Standard – First train to Mianchi (Longhai Railway)
  • Standard - Sanmenxia to Lingbao (Longhai Railway)
  • Standard – Night freight (Longhai Railway)
  • Standard – Heavy freight to Sanmenxia (Longhai Railway)

More scenarios are available on the Steam Workshop online and in-game. Train Simulator’s Steam Workshop scenarios are free and easy to download, adding many more hours of exciting gameplay. With scenarios being added daily, why don’t you check it out now!

Key Features


  • Highly detailed model of the HXD1
  • Detailed state-of-the-art driver's cab
  • Anti-Drowsiness Vigilance System (ADVS)
  • Automatic Train Protection (ATP)
  • Switchable dynamic pantograph height
  • LKJ Supervision and audible driver alerts
  • In-cab displays showing signal information
  • Selection of freight rolling stock included with C62 gondola, P54 freight car, NX70A wagons and G60K oil tankers
  • English and Chinese language manuals
  • 3 Scenarios for South West China High Speed
  • 5 Scenarios for Longhai Railway
  • Quick Drive compatible
  • Download size: 124 MB

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum for 32-bit:
  • OS *: 32-bit Windows 7 Service Pack 1, 8.1 or 10 Required (Other OS versions and types are not supported)
  • Processor: Intel Core-i3 4330 3.50 GHz Dual Core or AMD A8 6600K 3.90 GHz Quad Core or Better
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 750 Ti or AMD Radeon R9 Graphics with 1 GB Dedicated VRAM or Better
  • DirectX®: 9.0c
  • Network: Broadband Connection (May incur additional costs for use)
  • Storage: 40 GB or more available space (Additional Add-Ons will require more)
  • Sound Card: DirectX Compatible Audio Device
  • Additional Notes: Requires mouse and keyboard or Xbox Controller
Laptop, Notebook, Mobile or Low Power versions of the above specifications (including Intel or Integrated Graphics) may work but are not supported. Updates to Chipset, Graphics and Audio Device Drivers may be required. For information relating to recommended specifications for Train Simulator 64-bit, please refer to the Train Simulator Classic User Guide.
